question:
You've seen an advertisement from a couple, who live in Australia, for someone to teach their children your language for a year. 
In your letter, 
-Explain why you would be suitable for the job
-say what else you could do for the family
-give reasons for wanting the job.
text: I am writing this letter to express my strong interest in the Mandarin tutor position listed on Indeed.com.

In my previous experience, I have taught Mandarin to high school students in a private institute for the past 3 years. With my help, the students were able to develop effective study strategies, and thus most of them achieved high scores on their school tests.
Additionally, aside from my language skill, I am an expert in cooking as well, which means I could teach your children to make authentic Chinese cuisine after the language lessons.

Not only does my experience make me a competitive candidate, but my passion for helping students grow solid communication abilities and introducing Asian culture to them have also been the biggest reasons that I apply for this job.
Thank you for your consideration. I look forward to hearing from you soon.
